kayla.goal: Schedule a one-hour meeting on Monday between 9:00 and 17:00 that works for all participants.

sandra.goal: Schedule a one-hour meeting on Monday between 9:00 and 17:00 that works for all participants.

ryan.goal: Schedule a one-hour meeting on Monday between 9:00 and 17:00 that works for all participants.

kathleen.goal: Schedule a one-hour meeting on Monday between 9:00 and 17:00 that works for all participants.

walter.goal: Schedule a one-hour meeting on Monday between 9:00 and 17:00 that works for all participants.

arthur.goal: Schedule a one-hour meeting on Monday between 9:00 and 17:00 that works for all participants.

heather.goal: Schedule a one-hour meeting on Monday between 9:00 and 17:00 that works for all participants.

orchestrator.goal: Integrate participant schedules and produce a joint PDDL domain and problem to find a one-hour meeting slot on Monday between 9:00 and 17:00 that is free for all participants.

public_information: Find a time slot that is free for all participants

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert with PDDL problems for FastDownward. You always provide a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file that represent your knowledge about available free time and busy intervals. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.
pddl.prompt: Your name is kayla. You are in an environment with the following public information: {environment->public_information}. You have the following knowledge: {agents->kayla->private_information}. The global goal is: {agents->kayla->goal}. Think step by step and provide a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file for FastDownward that encodes your availability and constraints. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. If information is missing, do not assume, only encode what you know.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert with multi-agent PDDL problems for FastDownward. You always provide a combined PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file that integrates the participants' availability while keeping their actions and constraints distinct. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. You will receive PDDL domain and problem outputs from multiple participants. Your task is to integrate these partial PDDL descriptions into a single FastDownward compatible PDDL domain and problem that finds a one-hour meeting slot on Monday between 9:00 and 17:00 that is free for all participants. Keep participant actions and predicates distinct. Here is the global goal: {agents->orchestrator->goal}. Here is the information from kayla: {pddl_kayla}. Here is the information from sandra: {pddl_sandra}. Here is the information from ryan: {pddl_ryan}. Here is the information from kathleen: {pddl_kathleen}. Here is the information from walter: {pddl_walter}. Here is the information from arthur: {pddl_arthur}. Here is the information from heather: {pddl_heather}. Think step by step and provide a single PDDL domain and a single PDDL problem for FastDownward that encodes all constraints and yields a valid one-hour meeting time. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.
